bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Christopher Reed, August 30, [19--]

div1.p: Reed writes that Christopher Reed's son does not have tuberculosis. Reed has been in Cuba studying yellow fever but has returned to finish the typhoid fever report.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Christopher Reed, August 30, [19--]

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Aug. 30-

div1.p:
I was
waiting for some word
from you before re-
porting on sputum-
Your postal came
this morning- I am
happy to report that
a careful examination
fails to show any
tubercle bacilli- Robert
must be a sufferer
from bronchial trouble.
Have you had an in-
telligent physician ex-
amine his lungs?
Your postal chanced
to find me here-
Have just returned
from Cuba, where
I have been nearly
all summer, study-
ing yellow fever.

I only came to finish
up a report on
Typhoid Fever, at which
I have been working
since August '98 - will
complete it, this
week -- then will join
Emily & little Blossom
at our Cabin in the
Mountains for about
three weeks, afterwards re-
turning to Havana
for the winter- I know
that you will be glad
to hear that my boy
has won his com-
mission as a lieutenant
in the regular Army-
After two years service
& a pretty stiff examina-
tion, he came out with
flying colors- He is now
an officer of the 10th Inf.
stationed at Cienfuegos
Cuba- Much love to your
children-
